byline.contributor: Jane Perlez contributed reporting from Islamabad, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

abstract: Powerful American delegation, including Sec of State Hillary Clinton and new Central Intelligence Agency director David H Petraeus, arrive in Islamabad to deliver starkest warning yet that the United States is prepared to attack extremist groups that use Pakistan as a haven to kill Americans; group plans to push their Pakistani counterparts to make definitive choice between fighting terrorists or supporting them.
snippet: Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton said the United States would act unilaterally if necessary to attack extremist groups that use Pakistan as a haven to kill Americans.
lead_paragraph: Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton said the United States would act unilaterally if necessary to attack extremist groups that use Pakistan as a haven to kill Americans.

headline.main: U.S. Officials Deliver Warning in Pakistan Over Extremists
headline.print_headline: U.S. Officials Deliver Blunt Warning in Pakistan Over Extremists
headline.seo: Top U.S. Officials Deliver Blunt Warning in Pakistan
